title: Create compliance reports for VMware products
content:
To create compliance reports for VMware products, including VMware VirtualCenter (vCenter), VMware vRealize Operations (vROps), and VMware vSphere Suite, follow these steps:

Currently, SAM's VMware content is available only to containerized UD/UCMDB 2021.02 or later deployments.
  1. Run required discovery jobs to prepare UD/UCMDB data.
    Product Discovery path Required jobs Required permissions Required license

    VMware VirtualCenter

    Manual
    1. Manual VMware VIM Connection
    2. VMware vCenter Topology by VIM
    • VIM protocol: Get permissions to access all the following Managed Object Browser (MOB) objects: Datacenter, LicenseManager, ComputeResource, ClusterComputeResource, ResourcePool, HostSystem, VirtualMachine, Datastore, Network, DistributedVirtualSwitch, DistributedVirtualPortGroup
    • HTTP protocol for RESTful APIs: adapters, deployment, versions, resources
    		 UD Premium
    Automatic
    1. Range IPs by ICMP
    2. Host Connection by Shell
    3. Host Applications by Shell
    4. Vmware vCenter Connection by VIM
    5. VMware vCenter Topology by VIM
    • VIM protocol: Get permissions to access all the following MOB objects: Datacenter, LicenseManager, ComputeResource, ClusterComputeResource, ResourcePool, HostSystem, VirtualMachine, Datastore, Network, DistributedVirtualSwitch, DistributedVirtualPortGroup
    • HTTP protocol for RESTful APIs: adapters, deployment, versions, resources
    • Shell (NTCMD, SSH, UDA, or PowerCmd) access to VMs that have vCenter installed. For more information, see How to Discover Host Resources and Applications.
    VMware vRealize Operations Manual
    1. Manual UriEndpoint Discovery
    2. VMware vROps Topology by WebServices
    • VIM protocol: Get permissions to access all the following Managed Object Browser (MOB) objects: Datacenter, LicenseManager, ComputeResource, ClusterComputeResource, ResourcePool, HostSystem, VirtualMachine, Datastore, Network, DistributedVirtualSwitch, DistributedVirtualPortGroup
    • HTTP protocol for RESTful APIs: adapters, deployment, versions, resources
    VMware vSphere Suite Same as vCenter Same as vCenter
  2. Synchronize the product family.
  3. Maintain license compatibility matrix based on the publisher's official documentation. 
  4. Configure license rules.
    Currently, the following license rules are available for VMware products. For more information about these rules, see Supported software titles.
    • VMware per-CPU licensing
    • VMware per-CPU licensing for vSphere 7
    • VMware Portable License Unit (PLU)
    • VMware per-instance licensing
  5. Configure license models to build license pool information.
    For more information about the settings, see Software coverage.
  6. Calculate license consumption.
  7. View compliance status.
  8. Analyze compliance report.
    Note: For vROps, if the discovery jobs can't find the physical machines where the virtual machines are running, SAM will fail to calculate license compliance.
